p: We further analyzed the composition of the esssential oils obtained from the four treatments. According to the GC-MS analysis, essential oil of A. heterotropoides var. mandshuricum was composed of phenylpropanoid compounds, aromatic compounds and terpenoids compounds. The gas chromatogram results of phenylpropanoid and aromatic compounds detected in the four essential oils are displayed in Fig 4. Only compounds with at least 85% similarity to NIST mass spectral library were selected. We identified 50, 50, 41 and 44 compounds in essential oils from plants grown in 100, 50, 24 and 12% full sunlight, respectively ( S1 Table). A marked difference was observed in the relative content of these compounds among the four light treatments ( Fig 5; S1 Table).
